document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Li, Tong, Gao, Jianjun & Chen, Hongwei
document.docTitle: Leucophenga piscifoliacea Huang & Chen, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part II: the ornata species group from East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence (I)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part II: the ornata species group from East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence (I)

heading.emphasis:
Leucophenga piscifoliacea Huang & Chen
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is very similar to
L . rectifoliacea
sp. nov. in the patterns of wing (
Fig. 3
E) and abdominal tergites (
Fig. 9
D–G), but can be distinguished from the latter by having the paramere curved basally and distally (
Fig. 28
C); aedeagus with 1 triangular projection subbasally and reticulated distally (
Fig. 28
D).

Description. Ocellar triangle dark brown, with ca. 2–5 setae above ocellar setae. Frons yellowish brown to dark brown. Pedicel yellow; first flagellomere brown. Clypeus brown to dark brown. Mesonotum yellowish brown to brown, with 3 dark brown longitudinal stripes on anterior 2 / 3 : broad medially and thin laterally in holotype (
Fig.
6
I), sometimes without any stripes in some paratypes . Postpronotal lobe yellow. Acrostichal setulae in ca. 14–16 irregular rows (
Fig.
6
I). Scutellum brown, pale at tip (
Fig.
6
I). Katepisternum mostly brownish yellow, brown anterior corner (
Fig. 6
J). Meron brown (
Fig. 6
J). Wing (
Fig. 3
E): Costal vein between R 2 + 3 and R 4 + 5 distally with ca. 6–8 peg-like spinules on ventral surface. Abdominal tergites brown to black (
Fig. 9
D–G); second yellow medially, each with a yellow patch laterally; third with a pair of narrow, yellow patches submedially on anterior margin; fourth and fifth each with a pair of yellow patches submedially; sixth yellow medially in holotype (
Fig. 9
D); sometimes fourth and fifth with a variety changes in some paratypes (
Fig. 9
E–G). Male terminalia: Epandrium with ca. 19 setae near posterior margin and ventral corner per side (
Fig. 28
A). Hypandrium with 1 small sensillum (
Fig. 28
B). Paramere with ca. 3 sensilla submedially and pubescence distally (
Fig. 28
C).

Type specimens.
Holotype ♂ (SCAU, No.
121845
), CHINA : Menglun, Mengla, Yunnan, alt. 580m ,
22 .iv. 2007
, ex tree trunk, HW Chen. Paratypes : CHINA :
2 ♂
, 2 ♀ (SCAU, Nos
121846
– 49 ), same data as holotype ; 1 ♀ (SCAU, No.
121944
), Shennongjia, Hubei, alt. 1700m ,
4 .viii. 2005
, ex tree trunk, HW Chen;
1 ♂
, 2 ♀ (SCAU, Nos
121940
– 42 ), Nanling, Shaoguan, Guangdong, alt. 900m ,
27 .iv. 2005
, ex tree trunks, HW Chen;
4 ♂
, 5 ♀ (SCAU, Nos
121931
– 39 ), Maoershan, Guilin, Guangxi, alt. 600m ,
6 .ix. 2006
, ex tree trunks, JJ Jiang, F Zhao;
1 ♂
(SCAU, No.
121943
), Jianfengling, Ledong, Hainan,
18 ° 41 'N
,
108 ° 52 'E
, alt. 950m ,
18 .iv. 2008
, ex tussock, JJ Gao;
2 ♂
, 2 ♀ (SCAU, Nos
121850

(SCAU, Nos

27 ° 12 'N
,
100 °03'E
, alt. 1400m ,
2 .x. 2011
, ex tree trunks, HW Chen; 1 ♀ (SCAU, No.
121945
), Tongmai, Bomi, Xizang,
30 °06'N
,
95 °05'E
, alt. alt. 2000m ,

1 ♂
(SCAU, No.
121946
), Camgor, East Java,
27 .xii. 2003
, ex tree trunk, MJ Toda.
Etymology. A combination of the Latin words “ piscis ” (= fish) + “ foliaceus ” (= folimu), referring to the aedeagus fish-shaped.
Distribution. China (Hubei, Guangdong, Guangxi, Hainan, Yunnan, Xizang), Indonesia (Java).
